info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 7:49AM CDT until April 7 at 11:18AM CDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County.
.Heavy rain from the past 24 hours will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Rough River near Dundee.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to late Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Trailer courts in Hartford flood. At 29.0 feet, KY 136 at Heflin Road floods near county line. KY 69 floods near intersection of US 231 in Hartford.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 23.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 28.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.7 feet on 05/03/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 200 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY MORNING
